editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: The Missal. F-22v: Office Prayers. F-74r: Ordinary of the Mass. F-94r: Anaphora of the Apostles, Qǝddase Ḫawaryat, ቅዳሴ፡ ሐዋርያት፡. F-99r: Anaphora of Our Lord, ቅዳሴ፡ እግዚእ፡. See Mercer.See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-111v: Anaphora of John, Son of Thunder, Qǝddase Yoḥannəs Wäldä Nägwädǝgwad, ቅዳሴ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጐድጓድ፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-127r: Anaphora of Our Lady Mary attributed to Cyriacus of Bəhənsa, Qǝddase Maryam Gwäs’a, ቅዳሴ፡ ማርያም፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-138v: Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers, Qǝddase za-Śäläsǝtu, ቅዳሴ፡ ዘሠለስቱ፡ ምዕት፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-152v: Anaphora of Athanasius the Apostolic, Qǝddase Atǝnatewos, ቅዳሴ፡ አትናቴዎስ፡. F-164v: Anaphora of Basil of Caesarea, Qǝddase Baslǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. Ff. 164v-172r: Anaphora of Gregory, brother of Basil, Qǝddase Gorǝgorǝyos, ‘Ǝḫǝwä Baslǝyos., ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ እኅወ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-181r: Anaphora of Epiphanius, Qǝddase Estifanǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ኤጲፋንዮስ፡. Ff. 181v-188r: Anaphora of John Chrysostom, Qǝddase Yoḥannəs Afä Wärq, ቅዳሴ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈወርቅ፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-196r: Anaphora of Cyril of Alexandria, Qǝddase Qerǝlos, ቅዳሴ፡ ቄርሎስ፡. F-203v: Anaphora of Jacob of Serugh, Qǝddase Ya’ǝkob Zä-Śǝrug, ቅዳሴ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F-207r: Anaphora of Dioscorus, Qǝddase Diosǝqoros, ቅዳሴ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡. F-211v: Anaphora of Gregory, the second, Qǝddase Gorǝgorǝyos Kalǝ‘, ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ካልዕ፡, also known as Anaphora of Gregory, the Wonder Worker, Qǝdase Gorǝgorǝyos, Gäbare mänkǝrat, ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ገባሬ፡ መንክራት፡. See HSEA; EMIP 27. F mentions bishops Matewos (1889-1926) and Qerelos (1874-1927)
